snippet: Mitt Romney did score some successes beyond his health care legislation as governor of Massachusetts, but critics say he never mastered reaching across the aisle.
abstract: Examination of Mitt Romney's tenure as Massachusetts governor undercuts the claims he made to extensive bipartisanship during the opening presidential debate; Massachusetts Democrats complained that Romney ignored, insulted and opposed them during his time in office.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney did score some successes beyond his health care legislation as governor of Massachusetts, but critics say he never mastered reaching across the aisle.

headline.seo: Romney Claims of Bipartisanship as Governor Face Challenge
headline.main: Romney Claims of Bipartisanship as Governor Face Challenge
